scenes.location: DARKNESS OF A BARELY LIT ROOM NIGHT 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUB DUB of a heart beat as the blood WHOOSHES by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREAKING OF THE ROCKING CHAIR, back and forth, back and f as a JANE,23, sweet and fresh faced contented young woman HUMS a lullaby. Music from Mozart plays in the background Light from a passing car illuminates JANE, long dark hair slender, pretty and very much pregnant. Jane rubs her sto gently. She continues to hum and rock. Puts her hands on her 8 month swollen belly.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I'm going to make such a good mother for you. You are so special. I --

dialogues.speaker: FOOTSTEPS POUND UP STAIRS. 3
dialogues.text: Jane pauses her chair mid stroke.

dialogues.speaker: DOORKNOB TURNS. 4
dialogues.text: Jane stops rocking. Holds her breath. She turns toward th door not knowing what to expect. DOOR SLAMS open, vibrating against the wall. She turns in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane lays in bed. GROANS. Turns on her side. A shiner on her left eye. On the bedside stand are flowers. Jane looks at the flowers and the crude card. CARD: Forgive me Sweet Pie. Jane smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You okay, Janey?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: He didn't know what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s hurting you. HeвЂ™s...heвЂ™s hurting...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: He..HeвЂ™s..I'1l talk to you later. DOOR KNOB TURNS. She hangs up quickly as Eddie comes in bearing a breakfas tray.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hey. You okay, babe? (sets the tray down) Here. Let me do that. (puts ice pack on her eye) She shrinks back as if afraid of being hit.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: If you hadn't...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I shouldnвЂ™t have talked back to you.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: And you know, you donвЂ™t do that. His fingers carass under her chin.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (nods ) The baby kicked today. You want to feel?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (touches her belly) Won't be much longer now. Maybe he'll come out with a wrench in his hand.  10 11 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby is curled in her placenta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie leans over Jane, touching her face with love, feeli father's pride. He touches her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why the hell isnвЂ™t he kicking for me?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It's a girl. * (on his reaction) At least that's what the doctor said. * The flowers and vase he brought crash to the floor. Jane breaks out in sobs. Eddie storms out of the room as Jane looked glazed at the broken vase and the food over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby curled in her placenta, her eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane rubs her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It's okay, baby. * Jane crawls from the bed and tries to clean up the mess. Stripping the dirty bed, and still sobbing, she goes over the CD player and puts on her Mozart. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane emerges from the shower, sans make up. She goes to t make up counter where everything has been put neatly in alphabetical order by Eddie. She accidently knocks a jar from its aligned space. Hastily, she looks around, fearfu that Eddie might notice. She nudges it back into place. She wipes the fog off the mirror. Her bruises from the da before are clearly visible. She frowns and begins applyin make up. ItвЂ™s not covering it up. She puts on more and more. The thick make up is now more obvious than the brui She speaks in a mantra to herself.  13 14 15

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I love my husband. I do love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street the night lights of the liquor store go and off as the hours pass. Jane sits in the rocking chair going back and forth as she repeats her mantra. She's los in thought. The dinner table is perfectly set. The candles have burne low. She anxiously watches the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane has fallen asleep in the rocker. Her face is startin to show black and blue. She wakes and stares across the street.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (dulled) No, he's not here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. (forces a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I meant what I said. YouвЂ™re running out of time -

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Martin---

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You need to leave him. Listen...listen...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: And who's going to take care of me. You?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: My mama, she'll... I donвЂ™t know. Jane, you have to leave --  16

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: And who's going to take care of me? You?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I...you have to get out of there

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can't. He'd find me if I did.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Jane, the baby --

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s ..HeвЂ™s...I have to go. (abruptly hangs up) The door opens. Jane turns expectantly and starts to rise as the door ope She wears a long flowery skirt and long sleeved blouse. H hair is tied back with a bow.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: That was just...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I know who it was.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Martin just called to --

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sit down, Bitch. I'm through with you and your lies. He advances toward her.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Eddie, please. The baby. He wipes a clean surface and looks at his finger, looking dust.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Clean this house. ItвЂ™s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m ...IвЂ™m going to bed.  17

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No, youвЂ™re not. Eddie grabs JaneвЂ™s arm.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Stop it, please! YouвЂ™re hurt- scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sit down! Eddie pulls her arm towards the ground, with it her body follows. Jane resists and eases her arm from his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Bitch! He back-hands her against the jaw. The blow is severe. Ja buckles backwards, trips and SLAMS her head against the TABLEвЂ™S EDGE. She slumps to the floor, motionless. The carpet swells with blood.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Get up! Jane lies motionless.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Jane? Stop fooling. Jane, get up! Jane remains unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I was just kidding. (realizes sheвЂ™s gone) Fucking shit! SILENCE. Then, Eddie frantically rolls the carpet near her so that it lo like she tripped and pulls his cellphone out and dials 9-

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Send help! My wifeвЂ™s fallen.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE SCREAMS/SIRENS
dialogues.text: 18 7. INT.EDDIEвЂ™S APARTMENT - A FEW MOMENTS LATER 18 TWO PARAMEDICS rush to Jane, quickly assessing the scene. Eddie sits silent, motionless on the bed; white, blank, s stare. The Paramedics kneel to Janes side. They quickly assess t situation and perform CPR with no hesitation. Their movem is sound, their skill precise. Martin rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I...she tripped.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You ---

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Doofus. FIVE MINUTES PASS. An exhausted, somber Paramedic 1 leans down and takes Jan pulse. The cardiac monitor sounds a sharp pitched tone as beams a flat-line.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s jolt her. The other nods as she applies the paddles to the chest.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Stand back! Jane's bodyвЂ™s jerk but there is nothing happening. Her eyes are wide open, the blood fills the carpet in sma gushes. One paramedic shakes his head вЂњnoвЂќ to the oth Janey is dead.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Do it again...please. Jane...she...

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, Sir. Paramedic 1 removes her white, latex gloves. She applies sanitizer. The sound of the liquid glides out of the bott Eddie thinks he can hear it, for just a second.  8. Paramedic 1 notices small amounts of blood protruding fro Jane's mouth. SLOW MOTION: A drop hits the carpet. Eddie stands there, just staring.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Sir! Eddie jolts from his trance.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Did you do this?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. (chills) I tell ya, she tripped. He looks from the paramedics to Martin. He listens with the stethoscope. A sharp TONE blasts against the room. ItвЂ™s startling. T

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (whisper) ItвЂ™s beating. Eddie leans forward. Swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s alive? Eddie rubs his hands together, impatiently looks to the d eyeing an escape. The tone sounds again. Then again. The HEART BEAT of the baby can be heard through the dopler.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: No. Its the baby. The babyвЂ™s heart is beating. Paramedic 1 takes the dopler and places it again on the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: We have fetal movement. Strong. (then) This baby is kicking. LetвЂ™s get her moving. Now. Eddie backs away from his exit, towards the scene. He pee over the medics at JaneyвЂ™s eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie. Eddie jolts.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (to Eddie) Step back. Give us some room.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Step back!! JANE abruptly sits up, blood seeping from her wound. Eddi JOLTS with a SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me, Eddie. Eddie cringes at her sight, trembling in a pulse of fear. opens his eyes. Empty. The room is empty. Paramedics GONE. Only the pool of bloo remains on the carpet where Jane once laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits in his chair waiting form something, anything. has not slept and it shows. Martin paces the room. From the strong white GAZE of the hospital BRIGHT LIGHTS emerges a DOCTOR, male, 60s.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Hutchins? Eddie nods. The doctor sits. Martin sits down next to Edd and tries to comfort him but Eddie shrugs him off. Then,

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Sir. We saved your baby.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that supposed to mean? Jane is dead! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 10. EDDIE (cont'd) (Sobs ) Oh, my God. I loved her! I swear I did. I loved her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Of course you did.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Fuck you! You didnвЂ™t even try to save her.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Eddie ...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You shut up, Doofus. When I want your opinion, IвЂ™1l ask. The doctor reluctantly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It was no...We performed an emergency c-section.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: A little girl?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: A healthy little girl.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do... INT. EDDIEвЂ™S APARTMENT - DAY. 19 SUPERIMPOSE: 4 YEARS LATER. Eddie drunk on the sofa. Little Janey, age 4, pounds with her pretend hammer into blocks and then picking up Jane and Eddie's wedding pictu and pounding it until the glass shatters. She looks at Ed directly. INTERCUT BETWEEN DOORWAY and LIVING ROOM AS NECESSARY. The door opens and Martin lets himself inside. Eddie catches the stare of his 4 year old daughter. Chill  11.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (whisper) Eddie. Eddie JOLTs quickly. Standing above him is Jane, BLOODIED holding a shard of glass.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No! Jane HAMMERS down the glass into EddieвЂ™s GUT. He buckle towards the wound.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Eddie? Eddie pulls the glass from his stomach. Blood pulls aroun his waist.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. Jane is gone. In her place stands Janey, the 4 year old, holding the glass, SMILING. Eddie bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Jane! His eyes wide open. NORMAL. Janey plays in the corner wit her hammer. She looks to her father and SMILES. Martin enters the room and bends down so that he's eye le with JANEY.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What are doing, Sweetheart? Janey playfully holds her hands up to Martin.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s the matter with, Eddie? Nightmare?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kind of. He reaches for his bottle of Scotch and starts to pour. Martin takes the bottle from him. There's a slight strugg Eddie nods. He glances again at JANEY, watching warily as plays with her toy hammer and blocks.  20 Eddie releases his grasp on the BOTTLE.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, youвЂ™re right. I donвЂ™t need a drink. INT. LIVING ROOM OF APARTMENT. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER IMPOSE
dialogues.text: Eddie is on the phone with a crisis HOTLINE.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t understand. IвЂ™m not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CRISIS WORKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Have you had any alternative substances today?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t give me that shit! IвЂ™m hearing voices! TheyвЂ™re real lady!

dialogues.speaker: CRISIS WORKER, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Are you a threat to yourself or others?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No, IвЂ™m not. (then) The kid is. 12. 20 He sees LITTLE JANEY (14) standing in the doorway, watchi him. Slowly, he puts down the phone. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re home. HeвЂ™s nervous.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: Just fine, Daddy. She returns a slow, half-witting smile.  21 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Janey, 14, sits in the exact rocking chair where h mother sat. She reads Jane Eyre. On the desk is a picture her mother. It's uncanny how much the child looks like he mother, even to her hair style. Her hair has grown long Eddie stops in the doorway with groceries in his arms. He swallows hard as if seeing a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: D'ya always gotta have a book in your hand, kid?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: I like to read, Daddy. Didn't Mommy like to read, too?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (Stammers ) H...how would y...you know about y...your m...mother, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Janey shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: Martin told me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (in a rush) I gota go out. There's spaghetti in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: Sure, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I loved you, Eddie. Why did you hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (spins around) Whatja say?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: Nothing, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Stop playing games with my head, kid.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t play games.  22 23 24 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is bathed in moonlight. Wearing a long flowery s and blouse, similar to what her mother wore before her de Little Janey Puts on Mozart and sits in the rocker, rhythmically going back and forth. Her is tied back with bow. The rocker CREAKS BACK AND FORTH.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR KNOB TURNS 24
dialogues.text: Eddie enters and blinks, barely able to see in the darken apartment.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What the...turn on the fuckin' lights. Not like I can't afford them.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: No, leave them off. She stands and walks toward him, looking amazingly like h mother.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (drunk) Whereja get those clothes? Huh, where? He approaches her angrily, almost ready to rip them off. avoids him laughing and returns to the rocker.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) I found them. In a trunk. They were mother's, weren't they?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Take'm off.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: No. Other kids have parties for their birthdays. But what do I have? A father who murdered my mother.  15.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Shut up! Turn that record off before I slap you one.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: Oh, don't you like the music, Eddie? It was with mother's things. I'm going to kill you Eddie. Janey stands out of the rocker looking every bit like her mother. She walks forward. EddieвЂ™s face is white.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Get away from me! Go back! Get away!

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Eddie, why did you have to be so cruel? Why did you have to kill me? I loved you, Eddie. He turns and looks for an escape, but sees none. With eac step she takes forward, he takes one back. He doesn't realize that he is nearing the carpet that Jane had falle on. He hits his head, just as Jane had. The force of his fall is so great that he just lies there eyes open. She kicks the rug over to look as if he has tripped, then picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JANEY
dialogues.text: My fatherвЂ™s fallen. Send help. She smiles. The End Titles at the end have the phone number.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Three out of four people know a victim of partnership or dating violence One in four women; one in nine men are victims of domesti violence at some point in their lives. Every fifteen minutes a woman is abused. Teens are not immune.  16. Violence against women happens in every culture and acros the socioeconomic board. DonвЂ™t be a victim. If you or someone you know is in danger, please call the Hotline by phone at 1-800-799-SAFE (7233),
